verses.kjv: And the LORD said unto Moses, Go in unto Pharaoh: for I have hardened his heart, and the heart of his servants, that I might shew these my signs before him:
verses.ct: The LORD told Moses, "Go to Pharaoh, because I have made his heart and the hearts of his officials stubborn so that I can display these signs of mine in front of him,

verses.kjv: And that thou mayest tell in the ears of thy son, and of thy son’s son, what things I have wrought in Egypt, and my signs which I have done among them; that ye may know how that I am the LORD.
verses.ct: and so that you can tell your children and grandchildren about what I did in Egypt and about the signs I performed among them. Then you will all know that I am the LORD."

verses.kjv: And Moses and Aaron came in unto Pharaoh, and said unto him, Thus saith the LORD God of the Hebrews, How long wilt thou refuse to humble thyself before me? let my people go, that they may serve me.
verses.ct: So Moses and Aaron went to Pharaoh and told him, "This is what the LORD, the God of the Hebrews, says: 'How long will you refuse to humble yourself before me? Let my people go so they can worship me.

verses.kjv: Else, if thou refuse to let my people go, behold, to morrow will I bring the locusts into thy coast:
verses.ct: If you refuse to let my people go, pay attention — tomorrow I will bring locusts into your territory.

verses.kjv: And they shall cover the face of the earth, that one cannot be able to see the earth: and they shall eat the residue of that which is escaped, which remaineth unto you from the hail, and shall eat every tree which groweth for you out of the field:
verses.ct: They will cover the entire surface of the ground so thickly that no one will be able to see the earth beneath them. They will devour whatever survived the hail — everything that remains for you — and they will strip every tree growing in your fields.

verses.kjv: And they shall fill thy houses, and the houses of all thy servants, and the houses of all the Egyptians; which neither thy fathers, nor thy fathers’ fathers have seen, since the day that they were upon the earth unto this day. And he turned himself, and went out from Pharaoh.
verses.ct: They will fill your palace, the homes of all your officials, and the homes of every Egyptian. It will be something that neither your fathers nor your grandfathers have ever seen from the time they lived on this earth until today.'" Then Moses turned and left Pharaoh's presence.

verses.kjv: And Pharaoh’s servants said unto him, How long shall this man be a snare unto us? let the men go, that they may serve the LORD their God: knowest thou not yet that Egypt is destroyed?
verses.ct: Pharaoh's officials said to him, "How long is this man going to be a trap for us? Let the people go so they can worship the LORD their God. Don't you realize yet that Egypt is ruined?"

verses.kjv: And Moses and Aaron were brought again unto Pharaoh: and he said unto them, Go, serve the LORD your God: but who are they that shall go?
verses.ct: So Moses and Aaron were brought back to Pharaoh, and he said to them, "Go ahead, worship the LORD your God. But exactly who will be going?"

verses.kjv: And Moses said, We will go with our young and with our old, with our sons and with our daughters, with our flocks and with our herds will we go; for we must hold a feast unto the LORD.
verses.ct: Moses replied, "We will go with everyone — young and old, sons and daughters — and we will bring our flocks and herds, because we must celebrate a festival to the LORD."

verses.kjv: And he said unto them, Let the LORD be so with you, as I will let you go, and your little ones: look to it; for evil is before you.
verses.ct: Pharaoh said to them, "The LORD had better be with you if I ever let you take your children along! Clearly you have some evil plan in mind."

verses.kjv: Not so: go now ye that are men, and serve the LORD; for that ye did desire. And they were driven out from Pharaoh’s presence.
verses.ct: "Absolutely not! Only the men may go and worship the LORD, since that's what you originally asked for." Then Moses and Aaron were thrown out of Pharaoh's presence.

verses.kjv: And the LORD said unto Moses, Stretch out thine hand over the land of Egypt for the locusts, that they may come up upon the land of Egypt, and eat every herb of the land, even all that the hail hath left.
verses.ct: The LORD said to Moses, "Raise your hand over the land of Egypt to summon the locusts, so they will swarm across the land and consume every plant — everything the hail left behind."

verses.kjv: And Moses stretched forth his rod over the land of Egypt, and the LORD brought an east wind upon the land all that day, and all that night; and when it was morning, the east wind brought the locusts.
verses.ct: Moses raised his staff over the land of Egypt, and the LORD sent an east wind blowing across the land all that day and all through the night. By morning, the east wind had carried in the locusts.

verses.kjv: And the locusts went up over all the land of Egypt, and rested in all the coasts of Egypt: very grievous were they; before them there were no such locusts as they, neither after them shall be such.
verses.ct: The locusts swarmed over the entire land of Egypt and settled across every region. The infestation was devastating — there had never been a locust plague like it before, and there never will be again.

verses.kjv: For they covered the face of the whole earth, so that the land was darkened; and they did eat every herb of the land, and all the fruit of the trees which the hail had left: and there remained not any green thing in the trees, or in the herbs of the field, through all the land of Egypt.
verses.ct: They covered the entire surface of the ground until the land turned dark with them. They consumed every plant and all the fruit on the trees that the hail had spared. Not a single green thing remained — no tree or plant in any field throughout all of Egypt.

verses.kjv: Then Pharaoh called for Moses and Aaron in haste; and he said, I have sinned against the LORD your God, and against you.
verses.ct: Pharaoh urgently summoned Moses and Aaron and said, "I have sinned against the LORD your God and against you.

verses.kjv: Now therefore forgive, I pray thee, my sin only this once, and intreat the LORD your God, that he may take away from me this death only.
verses.ct: Please forgive my sin just this once, and pray to the LORD your God to take this deadly plague away from me."

verses.kjv: And he went out from Pharaoh, and intreated the LORD.
verses.ct: Moses left Pharaoh and prayed to the LORD.

verses.kjv: And the LORD turned a mighty strong west wind, which took away the locusts, and cast them into the Red sea; there remained not one locust in all the coasts of Egypt.
verses.ct: The LORD shifted the wind to a very powerful west wind that swept up the locusts and drove them into the Red Sea. Not a single locust remained anywhere in Egypt.

verses.kjv: But the LORD hardened Pharaoh’s heart, so that he would not let the children of Israel go.
verses.ct: But the LORD made Pharaoh's heart stubborn, and he refused to let the Israelites go.

verses.kjv: And the LORD said unto Moses, Stretch out thine hand toward heaven, that there may be darkness over the land of Egypt, even darkness which may be felt.
verses.ct: Then the LORD said to Moses, "Raise your hand toward the heavens so that darkness will spread over the land of Egypt — a darkness so thick it can be felt."

verses.kjv: And Moses stretched forth his hand toward heaven; and there was a thick darkness in all the land of Egypt three days:
verses.ct: Moses raised his hand toward the heavens, and a dense darkness covered the entire land of Egypt for 3 days.

verses.kjv: They saw not one another, neither rose any from his place for three days: but all the children of Israel had light in their dwellings.
verses.ct: No one could see anyone else, and nobody left their home for 3 days. But all the Israelites had light where they lived.

verses.kjv: And Pharaoh called unto Moses, and said, Go ye, serve the LORD; only let your flocks and your herds be stayed: let your little ones also go with you.
verses.ct: Pharaoh summoned Moses and said, "Go worship the LORD. Even your children can go with you. Just leave your flocks and herds behind."

verses.kjv: And Moses said, Thou must give us also sacrifices and burnt offerings, that we may sacrifice unto the LORD our God.
verses.ct: But Moses replied, "You must also provide us with animals for sacrifices and burnt offerings so we can offer them to the LORD our God.

verses.kjv: Our cattle also shall go with us; there shall not an hoof be left behind; for thereof must we take to serve the LORD our God; and we know not with what we must serve the LORD, until we come thither.
verses.ct: Our livestock must come with us too — not a single hoof will be left behind. We need them to worship the LORD our God, and we won't know exactly what the LORD requires until we arrive there."

verses.kjv: But the LORD hardened Pharaoh’s heart, and he would not let them go.
verses.ct: But the LORD made Pharaoh's heart stubborn, and he refused to let them go.

verses.kjv: And Pharaoh said unto him, Get thee from me, take heed to thyself, see my face no more; for in that day thou seest my face thou shalt die.
verses.ct: Pharaoh said to Moses, "Get away from me! Make sure you never come into my presence again, because the day you appear before me, you will die."

verses.kjv: And Moses said, Thou hast spoken well, I will see thy face again no more.
verses.ct: Moses replied, "You have spoken correctly. I will never appear before you again."
